intro: Nolina glauca, commonly known as the silver nolina, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its cylindrical, gray-green stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are covered in a waxy coating. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the rainy season. Nolina glauca is well adapted to drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
